content.raw:
I have a couple concerns with this approach.

1. The implementation of the URI class is gazebo specific, and seems very complex. The URI class will make its way into ign-common, and should not be so explicitly tied to Gazebo.

2. It would be nice if the URI class followed common naming conventions: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Uniform_Resource_Identifier

Here is an example implementation that resolves these two issues (it needs some fine-tuning): #!/osrf/gazebo/branch/uri_nate
